data.title: Bank Heist
data.statement:
A band of silly-masked heisters is planning the next bank heist, they retrieved the guards shifts informations. You must output the time spans at which there is the lowest amount of guards!

Everything must be done in <<one day>> so the time span considered is 0:00 to 24:00

If there is the same amount of guards the whole day... all day is good!
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read shift:string(100)
write 0->24
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of guards working that day.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Two integers <<xi>> and <<yi>> (0 ≤ xi < yi ≤ 24) separated by "->" denoting that shift of <<i-th>> guard starts and xi hours and ends at yi hours
(Ex: {{6->14}} meaning the guard shift goes from 6:00 to 14:00)
data.outputDescription:
A single line containing the periods of time with the lowest amount of guards.
All continuous periods are in the [[x->y]] format, separated by space, ordered by x.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A band of silly-masked heisters is planning the next bank heist, they retrieved the guards shifts informations. You must output the time spans at which there is the lowest amount of guards!

Everything must be done in one day so the time span considered is 0:00 to 24:00

If there is the same amount of guards the whole day... all day is good!
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of guards working that day.
Next N lines: Two integers xi and yi (0 ≤ xi < yi ≤ 24) separated by "->" denoting that shift of i-th guard starts and xi hours and ends at yi hours
(Ex: 6->14 meaning the guard shift goes from 6:00 to 14:00)
Output
A single line containing the periods of time with the lowest amount of guards.
All continuous periods are in the x->y format, separated by space, ordered by x.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 11
Shift: x->y x < y (No night shifts. Ex: 22->7)
Example
Input
1
0->18
Output
18->24
